properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the resource group. Must be unique on your Azure subscription.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location where the resource group should be created. For a list of all Azure locations, please consult this link or run az account list-locations --output table.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the availability set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the availability set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: platform_update_domain_count
properties.description: • platform_update_domain_count - (Optional) Specifies the number of update domains that are used. Defaults to 5.
NOTE: The number of Update Domains varies depending on which Azure Region you're using - a list can be found here.

properties.name: platform_fault_domain_count
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of fault domains that are used. Defaults to 3.
NOTE: The number of Fault Domains varies depending on which Azure Region you're using - a list can be found here.

properties.name: managed
properties.description: • managed - (Optional) Specifies whether the availability set is managed or not. Possible values are true (to specify aligned) or false (to specify classic). Default is false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the managed disk. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the managed disk.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specified the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_type
properties.description: • storage_account_type - (Required) The type of storage to use for the managed disk. Allowable values are Standard_LRS or Premium_LRS.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: create_option - (Required) The method to use when creating the managed disk. Possible values include:

properties.name: Import
properties.description: Import a VHD file in to the managed disk (VHD specified with source_uri).

properties.name: Empty
properties.description: Create an empty managed disk.

properties.name: Copy
properties.description: Copy an existing managed disk or snapshot (specified with source_resource_id).

properties.name: FromImage
properties.description: Copy a Platform Image (specified with image_reference_id)

properties.name: source_uri
properties.description: • source_uri - (Optional) URI to a valid VHD file to be used when create_option is Import.

properties.name: source_resource_id
properties.description: • source_resource_id - (Optional) ID of an existing managed disk to copy create_option is Copy.

properties.name: image_reference_id
properties.description: • image_reference_id - (Optional) ID of an existing platform/marketplace disk image to copy when create_option is FromImage.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Optional) Specify a value when the source of an Import or Copy operation targets a source that contains an operating system. Valid values are Linux or Windows

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: • disk_size_gb - (Optional, Required for a new managed disk) Specifies the size of the managed disk to create in gigabytes. If create_option is Copy or FromImage, then the value must be equal to or greater than the source's size.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
For more information on managed disks, such as sizing options and pricing, please check out the azure documentation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the virtual machine resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual machine.

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure Stack Region where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: plan
properties.description: (Optional) A plan block as documented below.

properties.name: availability_set_id
properties.description: (Optional) The Id of the Availability Set in which to create the virtual machine

properties.name: boot_diagnostics
properties.description: (Optional) A boot diagnostics profile block as referenced below.

properties.name: vm_size
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the size of the virtual machine.

properties.name: storage_image_reference
properties.description: (Optional) A Storage Image Reference block as documented below.

properties.name: storage_os_disk
properties.description: (Required) A storage_os_disk block.

properties.name: storage_data_disk
properties.description: (Optional) A list of Storage Data disk blocks as referenced below.

properties.name: delete_os_disk_on_termination
properties.description: (Optional) Should the OS Disk be deleted when the Virtual Machine is destroyed? Defaults to false.

properties.name: delete_data_disks_on_termination
properties.description: (Optional) Flag to enable deletion of storage data disk VHD blobs when the VM is deleted, defaults to false.

properties.name: os_profile
properties.description: (Optional) An OS Profile block as documented below. Required when create_option in the storage_os_disk block is set to FromImage.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) An identity block as documented below.

properties.name: license_type
properties.description: • license_type - (Optional, when a Windows machine) Specifies the Windows OS license type. If supplied, the only allowed values are Windows_Client and Windows_Server.

properties.name: os_profile_windows_config
properties.description: • os_profile_windows_config - (Required, when a Windows machine) A Windows config block as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile_linux_config
properties.description: • os_profile_linux_config - (Required, when a Linux machine) A Linux config block as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile_secrets
properties.description: • os_profile_secrets - (Optional) A collection of Secret blocks as documented below.

properties.name: network_interface_ids
properties.description: • network_interface_ids - (Required) Specifies the list of resource IDs for the network interfaces associated with the virtual machine.

properties.name: primary_network_interface_id
properties.description: • primary_network_interface_id - (Optional) Specifies the resource ID for the primary network interface associated with the virtual machine.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
For more information on the different example configurations, please check out the azure documentation
Plan supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the image from the marketplace.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image.

properties.name: product
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the product of the image from the marketplace.
boot_diagnostics supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: : (Required) Whether to enable boot diagnostics for the virtual machine.

properties.name: storage_uri
properties.description: : (Required) Blob endpoint for the storage account to hold the virtual machine's diagnostic files. This must be the root of a storage account, and not a storage container.
storage_image_reference supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of the (custom) image to use to create the virtual machine, for example:

resource "azurestack_image" "test" {
  name = "test"

  #...
}

resource "azurestack_virtual_machine" "test" {
  name = "test"

  #...

  storage_image_reference {
    id = "${azurestack_image.test.id}"
  }

  #...
}

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Required, when not using image resource) Specifies the publisher of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: offer
properties.description: (Required, when not using image resource) Specifies the offer of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: (Required, when not using image resource) Specifies the SKU of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the version of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
storage_os_disk block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the disk name.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: (Required) Specifies how the OS Disk should be created. Possible values are Attach (managed disks only) and FromImage.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements for the OS Disk. Possible values include None, ReadOnly and ReadWrite.

properties.name: image_uri
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the image_uri in the form publisherName:offer:skus:version. image_uri can also specify the VHD uri of a custom VM image to clone. When cloning a custom disk image the os_type documented below becomes required.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the Operating System on the OS Disk. Possible values are Linux and Windows.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the size of the os disk in gigabytes.
The following properties apply when using Managed Disks:

properties.name: managed_disk_id
properties.description: • managed_disk_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of an existing Managed Disk which should be attached as the OS Disk of this Virtual Machine. If this is set then the create_option must be set to Attach.

properties.name: managed_disk_type
properties.description: • managed_disk_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of Managed Disk which should be created. Possible values are Standard_LRS or Premium_LRS.
The following properties apply when using Unmanaged Disks:

properties.name: vhd_uri
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the URI of the VHD file backing this Unmanaged OS Disk. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
storage_data_disk supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the data disk.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: (Required) Specifies how the data disk should be created. Possible values are Attach, FromImage and Empty.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the size of the data disk in gigabytes.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements.

properties.name: lun
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the logical unit number of the data disk.
The following properties apply when using Managed Disks:

properties.name: managed_disk_type
properties.description: • managed_disk_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Possible values are either Standard_LRS or Premium_LRS.

properties.name: managed_disk_id
properties.description: • managed_disk_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of an Existing Managed Disk which should be attached to this Virtual Machine. When this field is set create_option must be set to Attach.
The following properties apply when using Unmanaged Disks:

properties.name: vhd_uri
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the URI of the VHD file backing this Unmanaged Data Disk. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
os_profile supports the following:

properties.name: computer_name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the virtual machine.

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the administrator account.

properties.name: admin_password
properties.description: (Required for Windows, Optional for Linux) Specifies the password of the administrator account.

properties.name: custom_data
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies custom data to supply to the machine. On linux-based systems, this can be used as a cloud-init script. On other systems, this will be copied as a file on disk. Internally, Terraform will base64 encode this value before sending it to the API. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.

NOTE: admin_password must be between 6-72 characters long and must satisfy at least 3 of password complexity requirements from the following: 1. Contains an uppercase character 2. Contains a lowercase character 3. Contains a numeric digit 4. Contains a special character
identity supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the identity type of the virtual machine. The only allowable value is SystemAssigned. To enable Managed Service Identity the virtual machine extension "ManagedIdentityExtensionForWindows" or "ManagedIdentityExtensionForLinux" must also be added to the virtual machine. The Principal ID can be retrieved after the virtual machine has been created, e.g.

resource "azurestack_virtual_machine" "test" {
  name = "test"

  identity = {
    type = "SystemAssigned"
  }
}

resource "azurestack_virtual_machine_extension" "test" {
  name                 = "test"
  resource_group_name  = "${azurestack_resource_group.test.name}"
  location             = "${azurestack_resource_group.test.location}"
  virtual_machine_name = "${azurestack_virtual_machine.test.name}"
  publisher            = "Microsoft.ManagedIdentity"
  type                 = "ManagedIdentityExtensionForWindows"
  type_handler_version = "1.0"

  settings = <<SETTINGS
    {
        "port": 50342
    }
SETTINGS
}

output "principal_id" {
  value = "${lookup(azurestack_virtual_machine.test.identity[0], "principal_id")}"
}
os_profile_windows_config supports the following:

properties.name: provision_vm_agent
properties.description: (Optional) This value defaults to false.

properties.name: enable_automatic_upgrades
properties.description: (Optional) This value defaults to false.

properties.name: winrm
properties.description: (Optional) A collection of WinRM configuration blocks as documented below.

properties.name: additional_unattend_config
properties.description: (Optional) An Additional Unattended Config block as documented below.
winrm supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the protocol of listener

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies URL of the certificate with which new Virtual Machines is provisioned.
additional_unattend_config supports the following:

properties.name: pass
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to. The only allowable value is oobeSystem.

properties.name: component
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content. The only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

properties.name: setting_name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies. Possible values are: FirstLogonCommands and AutoLogon.

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.
os_profile_linux_config supports the following:

properties.name: disable_password_authentication
properties.description: (Required) Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled. If set to false, an admin_password must be specified.

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a collection of path and key_data to be placed on the virtual machine.
Note: Please note that the only allowed path is /home/<username>/.ssh/authorized_keys due to a limitation of Azure.
os_profile_secrets supports the following:

properties.name: source_vault_id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the key vault to use.

properties.name: vault_certificates
properties.description: (Required) A collection of Vault Certificates as documented below
vault_certificates support the following:

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the URI of the key vault secrets in the format of https://<vaultEndpoint>/secrets/<secretName>/<secretVersion>. Stored secret is the Base64 encoding of a JSON Object that which is encoded in UTF-8 of which the contents need to be

{
  "data":"<Base64-encoded-certificate>",
  "dataType":"pfx",
  "password":"<pfx-file-password>"
}

properties.name: certificate_store
properties.description: (Required, on windows machines) Specifies the certificate store on the Virtual Machine where the certificate should be added to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine extension peering. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location where the extension is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_machine_name
properties.description: • virtual_machine_name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: • publisher - (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers can be found by using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can be found using the Azure CLI.
Note: The Publisher and Type of Virtual Machine Extensions can be found using the Azure CLI, via: shell $ az vm extension image list --location westus -o table

properties.name: type_handler_version
properties.description: • type_handler_version - (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: auto_upgrade_minor_version
properties.description: • auto_upgrade_minor_version - (Optional) Specifies if the platform deploys the latest minor version update to the type_handler_version specified.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: • settings - (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

Please Note: Certain VM Extensions require that the keys in the settings block are case sensitive. If you're seeing unhelpful errors, please ensure the keys are consistent with how Azure is expecting them (for instance, for the JsonADDomainExtension extension, the keys are expected to be in TitleCase.)

properties.name: protected_settings
properties.description: (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

Please Note: Certain VM Extensions require that the keys in the protected_settings block are case sensitive. If you're seeing unhelpful errors, please ensure the keys are consistent with how Azure is expecting them (for instance, for the JsonADDomainExtension extension, the keys are expected to be in TitleCase.)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the virtual machine scale set resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual machine scale set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: (Required) A sku block as documented below.

properties.name: upgrade_policy_mode
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the mode of an upgrade to virtual machines in the scale set. Possible values, Manual or Automatic.

properties.name: overprovision
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the virtual machine scale set should be overprovisioned. Defaults to true.

properties.name: license_type
properties.description: (Optional, when a Windows machine) Specifies the Windows OS license type. If supplied, the only allowed values are Windows_Client and Windows_Server.

properties.name: os_profile
properties.description: (Required) A Virtual Machine OS Profile block as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile_secrets
properties.description: (Optional) A collection of Secret blocks as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile_windows_config
properties.description: (Required, when a windows machine) A Windows config block as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile_linux_config
properties.description: (Required, when a linux machine) A Linux config block as documented below.

properties.name: network_profile
properties.description: (Required) A collection of network profile block as documented below.

properties.name: storage_profile_os_disk
properties.description: (Required) A storage profile os disk block as documented below

properties.name: storage_profile_data_disk
properties.description: (Optional) A storage profile data disk block as documented below

properties.name: storage_profile_image_reference
properties.description: (Optional) A storage profile image reference block as documented below.

properties.name: extension
properties.description: (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to add extension profiles to the scale set. Each extension block supports the fields documented below.

properties.name: plan
properties.description: (Optional) A plan block as documented below.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the priority for the virtual machines in the scale set, defaults to Regular. Possible values are Low and Regular.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

Please Note: Availability Zones are in Preview and only supported in several regions at this time - as such you must be opted into the Preview to use this functionality. You can opt into the Availability Zones Preview in the Azure Portal.
sku supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the size of virtual machines in a scale set.

properties.name: tier
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the tier of virtual machines in a scale set. Possible values, standard or basic.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the number of virtual machines in the scale set.
identity supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the identity type to be assigned to the scale set. The only allowable value is SystemAssigned. To enable Managed Service Identity (MSI) on all machines in the scale set, an extension with the type "ManagedIdentityExtensionForWindows" or "ManagedIdentityExtensionForLinux" must also be added. The scale set's Service Principal ID (SPN) can be retrieved after the scale set has been created.

resource "azurestack_virtual_machine_scale_set" "test" {
  name                = "vm-scaleset"
  resource_group_name = "${azurestack_resource_group.test.name}"
  location            = "${azurestack_resource_group.test.location}"

  sku {
    name     = "${var.vm_sku}"
    tier     = "Standard"
    capacity = "${var.instance_count}"
  }

  identity {
    type = "systemAssigned"
  }

  extension {
    name                 = "MSILinuxExtension"
    publisher            = "Microsoft.ManagedIdentity"
    type                 = "ManagedIdentityExtensionForLinux"
    type_handler_version = "1.0"
    settings             = "{\"port\": 50342}"
  }

  output "principal_id" {
    value = "${lookup(azurestack_virtual_machine.test.identity[0], "principal_id")}"
  }
}
os_profile supports the following:

properties.name: computer_name_prefix
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the computer name prefix for all of the virtual machines in the scale set. Computer name prefixes must be 1 to 9 characters long for windows images and 1

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the administrator account name to use for all the instances of virtual machines in the scale set.

properties.name: admin_password
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the administrator password to use for all the instances of virtual machines in a scale set.

properties.name: custom_data
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies custom data to supply to the machine. On linux-based systems, this can be used as a cloud-init script. On other systems, this will be copied as a file on disk. Internally, Terraform will base64 encode this value before sending it to the API. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.
os_profile_secrets supports the following:

properties.name: source_vault_id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the key vault to use.

properties.name: vault_certificates
properties.description: (Required, on windows machines) A collection of Vault Certificates as documented below
vault_certificates support the following:

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: (Required) It is the Base64 encoding of a JSON Object that which is encoded in UTF-8 of which the contents need to be data, dataType and password.

properties.name: certificate_store
properties.description: (Required, on windows machines) Specifies the certificate store on the Virtual Machine where the certificate should be added to.
os_profile_windows_config supports the following:

properties.name: provision_vm_agent
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machines in the scale set.

properties.name: enable_automatic_upgrades
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machines in the scale set are enabled for automatic updates.

properties.name: winrm
properties.description: (Optional) A collection of WinRM configuration blocks as documented below.

properties.name: additional_unattend_config
properties.description: (Optional) An Additional Unattended Config block as documented below.
winrm supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the protocol of listener

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies URL of the certificate with which new Virtual Machines is provisioned.
additional_unattend_config supports the following:

properties.name: pass
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to. The only allowable value is oobeSystem.

properties.name: component
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content. The only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

properties.name: setting_name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies. Possible values are: FirstLogonCommands and AutoLogon.

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.
os_profile_linux_config supports the following:

properties.name: disable_password_authentication
properties.description: (Required) Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a collection of path and key_data to be placed on the virtual machine.
Note: Please note that the only allowed path is /home/<username>/.ssh/authorized_keys due to a limitation of Azure
network_profile supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the network interface configuration.

properties.name: primary
properties.description: (Required) Indicates whether network interfaces created from the network interface configuration will be the primary NIC of the VM.

properties.name: ip_configuration
properties.description: (Required) An ip_configuration block as documented below.
public_ip_address_configuration supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the public ip address configuration

properties.name: idle_timeout
properties.description: (Required) The idle timeout in minutes. This value must be between 4 and 32.

properties.name: domain_name_label
properties.description: (Required) The domain name label for the dns settings.
storage_profile_os_disk supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the disk name. Must be specified when using unmanaged disk ('managed_disk_type' property not set).

properties.name: vhd_containers
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the vhd uri. Cannot be used when image or managed_disk_type is specified.

properties.name: managed_disk_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Value you must be either Standard_LRS or Premium_LRS. Cannot be used when vhd_containers or image is specified.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: (Required) Specifies how the virtual machine should be created. The only possible option is FromImage.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: None (default), ReadOnly, ReadWrite.

properties.name: image
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the blob uri for user image. A virtual machine scale set creates an os disk in the same container as the user image. Updating the osDisk image causes the existing disk to be deleted and a new one created with the new image. If the VM scale set is in Manual upgrade mode then the virtual machines are not updated until they have manualUpgrade applied to them. When setting this field os_type needs to be specified.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the operating system Type, valid values are windows, linux.
storage_profile_data_disk supports the following:

properties.name: lun
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the Logical Unit Number of the disk in each virtual machine in the scale set.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies how the data disk should be created. The only possible options are FromImage and Empty.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: None (default), ReadOnly, ReadWrite.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the size of the disk in GB. This element is required when creating an empty disk.
storage_profile_image_reference supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of the (custom) image to use to create the virtual machine scale set, as in the example below.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the publisher of the image used to create the virtual machines.

properties.name: offer
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the offer of the image used to create the virtual machines.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the SKU of the image used to create the virtual machines.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the version of the image used to create the virtual machines.
boot_diagnostics supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: : (Required) Whether to enable boot diagnostics for the virtual machine.

properties.name: storage_uri
properties.description: : (Required) Blob endpoint for the storage account to hold the virtual machine's diagnostic files. This must be the root of a storage account, and not a storage container.
extension supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the extension.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers can be found by using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can be found using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: type_handler_version
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: auto_upgrade_minor_version
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether or not to use the latest minor version available.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

properties.name: protected_settings
properties.description: (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
plan supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the image from the marketplace.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image.

properties.name: product
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the product of the image from the marketplace.

properties.name: example-of-storage_profile_image_reference-with-id
properties.description: » Example of storage_profile_image_reference with id

resource "azurestack_image" "test" {
  name = "test"

  #...
}

resource "azurestack_virtual_machine_scale_set" "test" {
  name = "test"

  #...

  storage_profile_image_reference {
    id = "${azurestack_image.test.id}"
  }

  #...
}
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the DNS A Record.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the resource group where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: zone_name
properties.description: • zone_name - (Required) Specifies the DNS Zone where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: TTL
properties.description: • TTL - (Required) The Time To Live (TTL) of the DNS record.

properties.name: records
properties.description: • records - (Required) List of IPv4 Addresses.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the DNS Zone. Must be a valid domain name.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the resource group where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the local network gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the local network gateway.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the local network gateway is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: gateway_address
properties.description: • gateway_address - (Required) The IP address of the gateway to which to connect.

properties.name: address_space
properties.description: • address_space - (Required) The list of string CIDRs representing the address spaces the gateway exposes.

properties.name: bgp_settings
properties.description: • bgp_settings - (Optional) A bgp_settings block as defined below containing the Local Network Gateway's BGP speaker settings.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
bgp_settings supports the following:

properties.name: asn
properties.description: • asn - (Required) The BGP speaker's ASN.

properties.name: bgp_peering_address
properties.description: • bgp_peering_address - (Required) The BGP peering address and BGP identifier of this BGP speaker.

properties.name: peer_weight
properties.description: • peer_weight - (Optional) The weight added to routes learned from this BGP speaker.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: route_table_name
properties.description: • route_table_name - (Required) The name of the route table within which create the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The destination CIDR to which the route applies, such as 10.1.0.0/16

properties.name: next_hop_type
properties.description: • next_hop_type - (Required) The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to. Possible values are VirtualNetworkGateway, VnetLocal, Internet, VirtualAppliance and None

properties.name: next_hop_in_ip_address
properties.description: • next_hop_in_ip_address - (Optional) Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the route table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: route
properties.description: • route - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to define multiple routes. Each route block supports fields documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The route block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The destination CIDR to which the route applies, such as 10.1.0.0/16

properties.name: next_hop_type
properties.description: • next_hop_type - (Required) The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to. Possible values are VirtualNetworkGateway, VnetLocal, Internet, VirtualAppliance and None.

properties.name: next_hop_in_ip_address
properties.description: • next_hop_in_ip_address - (Optional) Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the network interface. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the network interface. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the network interface is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_security_group_id
properties.description: • network_security_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Network Security Group to associate with the network interface.

properties.name: internal_dns_name_label
properties.description: • internal_dns_name_label - (Optional) Relative DNS name for this NIC used for internal communications between VMs in the same VNet

properties.name: enable_ip_forwarding
properties.description: • enable_ip_forwarding - (Optional) Enables IP Forwarding on the NIC. Defaults to false.

properties.name: dns_servers
properties.description: • dns_servers - (Optional) List of DNS servers IP addresses to use for this NIC, overrides the VNet-level server list

properties.name: ip_configuration
properties.description: • ip_configuration - (Required) One or more ip_configuration associated with this NIC as documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The ip_configuration block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) User-defined name of the IP.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Reference to a subnet in which this NIC has been created.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: • private_ip_address - (Optional) Static IP Address.

properties.name: private_ip_address_allocation
properties.description: • private_ip_address_allocation - (Required) Defines how a private IP address is assigned. Options are Static or Dynamic.

properties.name: public_ip_address_id
properties.description: • public_ip_address_id - (Optional) Reference to a Public IP Address to associate with this NIC

properties.name: load_balancer_backend_address_pools_ids
properties.description: • load_balancer_backend_address_pools_ids - (Optional) List of Load Balancer Backend Address Pool IDs references to which this NIC belongs

properties.name: load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids
properties.description: • load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids - (Optional) List of Load Balancer Inbound Nat Rules IDs involving this NIC

properties.name: application_security_group_ids
properties.description: • application_security_group_ids - (Optional) List of Application Security Group IDs which should be attached to this NIC

Note: Application Security Groups are currently in Public Preview on an opt-in basis. More information, including how you can register for the Preview, and which regions Application Security Groups are available in are available here

properties.name: primary
properties.description: (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to true this should be the first ip_configuration in the array.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the network security group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the network security group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: security_rule
properties.description: • security_rule - (Optional) One or more security_rule blocks as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The security_rule block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the security rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 characters.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Network protocol this rule applies to. Can be Tcp, Udp or * to match both.

properties.name: source_port_range
properties.description: • source_port_range - (Optional) Source Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any.

properties.name: destination_port_range
properties.description: • destination_port_range - (Optional) Destination Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any.

properties.name: source_address_prefix
properties.description: • source_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or source IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used.

properties.name: destination_address_prefix
properties.description: • destination_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or destination IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used.

properties.name: access
properties.description: • access - (Required) Specifies whether network traffic is allowed or denied. Possible values are Allow and Deny.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Required) Specifies the priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Required) The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic. Possible values are Inbound and Outbound.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the security rule. This needs to be unique across all Rules in the Network Security Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Network Security Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_security_group_name
properties.description: • network_security_group_name - (Required) The name of the Network Security Group that we want to attach the rule to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 characters.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Network protocol this rule applies to. Possible values include Tcp, Udp or * (which matches both).

properties.name: source_port_range
properties.description: • source_port_range - (Optional) Source Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any.

properties.name: destination_port_range
properties.description: • destination_port_range - (Optional) Destination Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any.

properties.name: source_address_prefix
properties.description: • source_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or source IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used.

properties.name: destination_address_prefix
properties.description: • destination_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or destination IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used.

properties.name: access
properties.description: • access - (Required) Specifies whether network traffic is allowed or denied. Possible values are Allow and Deny.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Required) Specifies the priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Required) The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic. Possible values are Inbound and Outbound.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Public IP resource . Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the public ip.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: public_ip_address_allocation
properties.description: • public_ip_address_allocation - (Required) Defines whether the IP address is static or dynamic. Options are Static or Dynamic.
Note Dynamic Public IP Addresses aren't allocated until they're assigned to a resource (such as a Virtual Machine or a Load Balancer) by design within Azure - more information is available below.

properties.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
properties.description: • idle_timeout_in_minutes - (Optional) Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes.

properties.name: domain_name_label
properties.description: • domain_name_label - (Optional) Label for the Domain Name. Will be used to make up the FQDN. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

properties.name: reverse_fqdn
properties.description: • reverse_fqdn - (Optional) A fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_network_name
properties.description: • virtual_network_name - (Required) The name of the virtual network to which to attach the subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The address prefix to use for the subnet.

properties.name: network_security_group_id
properties.description: • network_security_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Network Security Group to associate with the subnet.

properties.name: route_table_id
properties.description: • route_table_id - (Optional) The ID of the Route Table to associate with the subnet.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network.

properties.name: address_space
properties.description: • address_space - (Required) The address space that is used the virtual network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the virtual network is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: dns_servers
properties.description: • dns_servers - (Optional) List of IP addresses of DNS servers

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to define multiple subnets. Each subnet block supports fields documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The subnet block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the subnet.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The address prefix to use for the subnet.

properties.name: security_group
properties.description: • security_group - (Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with the subnet. (Referenced by id, ie. azurestack_network_security_group.test.id)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the connection. Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the connection Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the connection is located. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of the Virtual Network Gateway. Valid options is Vpn

properties.name: vpn_type
properties.description: • vpn_type - (Optional) The routing type of the Virtual Network Gateway. Only valid option is RouteBased.

properties.name: enable_bgp
properties.description: • enable_bgp - (Optional) If true, BGP (Border Gateway Protocol) is enabled for this connection. Defaults to false.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) Configuration of the size and capacity of the virtual network gateway. Valid options are Basic, Standard and HighPerformance.

properties.name: ip_configuration
properties.description: • ip_configuration - (Required) One or two ip_configuration blocks documented below. An active-standby gateway requires exactly one ip_configuration block whereas an active-active gateway requires exactly two ip_configuration blocks.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The ip_configuration block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A user-defined name of the IP configuration. Defaults to vnetGatewayConfig.

properties.name: private_ip_address_allocation
properties.description: • private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Defines how the private IP address of the gateways virtual interface is assigned. Valid options are Static or Dynamic. Defaults to Dynamic.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the gateway subnet of a virtual network in which the virtual network gateway will be created. It is mandatory that the associated subnet is named GatewaySubnet. Therefore, each virtual network can contain at most a single Virtual Network Gateway.

properties.name: public_ip_address_id
properties.description: • public_ip_address_id - (Optional) The ID of the public ip address to associate with the Virtual Network Gateway.
The bgp_settings block supports:

properties.name: asn
properties.description: • asn - (Optional) The Autonomous System Number (ASN) to use as part of the BGP.

properties.name: peering_address
properties.description: • peering_address - (Optional) The BGP peer IP address of the virtual network gateway. This address is needed to configure the created gateway as a BGP Peer on the on-premises VPN devices. The IP address must be part of the subnet of the Virtual Network Gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the connection. Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the connection Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the connection is located. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of connection. Valid options are IPsec (Site-to-Site), ExpressRoute (ExpressRoute), and Vnet2Vnet (VNet-to-VNet). Each connection type requires different mandatory arguments (refer to the examples above). Changing the connection type will force a new connection to be created.

properties.name: virtual_network_gateway_id
properties.description: • virtual_network_gateway_id - (Required) The ID of the Virtual Network Gateway in which the connection will be created. Changing the gateway forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: authorization_key
properties.description: • authorization_key - (Optional) The authorization key associated with the Express Route Circuit. This field is required only if the type is an ExpressRoute connection.

properties.name: express_route_circuit_id
properties.description: • express_route_circuit_id - (Optional) The ID of the Express Route Circuit when creating an ExpressRoute connection (i.e. when type is ExpressRoute). The Express Route Circuit can be in the same or in a different subscription.

properties.name: peer_virtual_network_gateway_id
properties.description: • peer_virtual_network_gateway_id - (Optional) The ID of the peer virtual network gateway when creating a VNet-to-VNet connection (i.e. when type is Vnet2Vnet). The peer Virtual Network Gateway can be in the same or in a different subscription.

properties.name: local_network_gateway_id
properties.description: • local_network_gateway_id - (Optional) The ID of the local network gateway when creating Site-to-Site connection (i.e. when type is IPsec).

properties.name: routing_weight
properties.description: • routing_weight - (Optional) The routing weight. Defaults to 10.

properties.name: shared_key
properties.description: • shared_key - (Optional) The shared IPSec key. A key must be provided if a Site-to-Site or VNet-to-VNet connection is created whereas ExpressRoute connections do not need a shared key.

properties.name: enable_bgp
properties.description: • enable_bgp - (Optional) If true, BGP (Border Gateway Protocol) is enabled for this connection. Defaults to false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the storage account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. This must be unique across the entire Azure service, not just within the resource group.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: account_kind
properties.description: • account_kind - (Optional) Defines the Kind of account. Valid option is Storage. . Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to Storage currently as per Azure Stack Storage Differences

properties.name: account_tier
properties.description: • account_tier - (Required) Defines the Tier to use for this storage account. Valid options are Standard and Premium. Changing this forces a new resource to be created - Can be provisioned, but no performance limit or guarantee.

properties.name: account_replication_type
properties.description: • account_replication_type - (Required) Defines the type of replication to use for this storage account. Valid option is LRS currently as per Azure Stack Storage Differences

properties.name: access_tier
properties.description: • access_tier - (Required for BlobStorage accounts) Defines the access tier for BlobStorage accounts. Valid options are Hot and Cold, defaults to Hot. - Currently Not Supported on Azure Stack

properties.name: account_encryption_source
properties.description: • account_encryption_source - (Optional) The Encryption Source for this Storage Account. Possible values are Microsoft.Keyvault and Microsoft.Storage. Defaults to Microsoft.Storage.

properties.name: custom_domain
properties.description: • custom_domain - (Optional) A custom_domain block as documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>

properties.name: custom_domain
properties.description: • custom_domain supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The Custom Domain Name to use for the Storage Account, which will be validated by Azure.

properties.name: use_subdomain
properties.description: • use_subdomain - (Optional) Should the Custom Domain Name be validated by using indirect CNAME validation?
Note: More information on Validation is available here
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the storage container. Must be unique within the storage service the container is located.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: container_access_type
properties.description: • container_access_type - (Optional) The 'interface' for access the container provides. Can be either blob, container or private. Defaults to private. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the storage blob. Must be unique within the storage container the blob is located.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_container_name
properties.description: • storage_container_name - (Required) The name of the storage container in which this blob should be created.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of the storage blob to be created. One of either block or page. When not copying from an existing blob, this becomes required.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) Used only for page blobs to specify the size in bytes of the blob to be created. Must be a multiple of 512. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Optional) An absolute path to a file on the local system. Cannot be defined if source_uri is defined.

properties.name: source_uri
properties.description: • source_uri - (Optional) The URI of an existing blob, or a file in the Azure File service, to use as the source contents for the blob to be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be defined if source is defined.

properties.name: parallelism
properties.description: • parallelism - (Optional) The number of workers per CPU core to run for concurrent uploads. Defaults to 8.

properties.name: attempts
properties.description: • attempts - (Optional) The number of attempts to make per page or block when uploading. Defaults to 1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the LoadBalancer.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the LoadBalancer.

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.

properties.name: frontend_ip_configuration
properties.description: • frontend_ip_configuration - (Optional) A frontend ip configuration block as documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
frontend_ip_configuration supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the frontend ip configuration.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: (Optional) Reference to subnet associated with the IP Configuration.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: (Optional) Private IP Address to assign to the Load Balancer. The last one and first four IPs in any range are reserved and cannot be manually assigned.

properties.name: private_ip_address_allocation
properties.description: (Optional) Defines how a private IP address is assigned. Options are Static or Dynamic.

properties.name: public_ip_address_id
properties.description: (Optional) Reference to Public IP address to be associated with the Load Balancer.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the LB Rule.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the Rule.

properties.name: frontend_ip_configuration_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration to which the rule is associated.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are Udp or Tcp.

properties.name: frontend_port
properties.description: (Required) The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each Rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

properties.name: backend_port
properties.description: (Required) The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.

properties.name: backend_address_pool_id
properties.description: (Optional) A reference to a Backend Address Pool over which this Load Balancing Rule operates.

properties.name: probe_id
properties.description: (Optional) A reference to a Probe used by this Load Balancing Rule.

properties.name: enable_floating_ip
properties.description: (Optional) Floating IP is pertinent to failover scenarios: a "floating” IP is reassigned to a secondary server in case the primary server fails. Floating IP is required for SQL AlwaysOn.

properties.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the timeout for the Tcp idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to Tcp.

properties.name: load_distribution
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the load balancing distribution type to be used by the Load Balancer. Possible values are: Default – The load balancer is configured to use a 5 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. SourceIP – The load balancer is configured to use a 2 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. SourceIPProtocol – The load balancer is configured to use a 3 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. Also known as Session Persistence, where the options are called None, Client IP and Client IP and Protocol respectively.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Backend Address Pool.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the Backend Address Pool.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the NAT Rule.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the NAT Rule.

properties.name: frontend_ip_configuration_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration exposing this rule.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are Udp or Tcp.

properties.name: frontend_port
properties.description: (Required) The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each Rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

properties.name: backend_port
properties.description: (Required) The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.

properties.name: enable_floating_ip
properties.description: (Optional) Enables the Floating IP Capacity, required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Probe.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the NAT Rule.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the protocol of the end point. Possible values are Http or Tcp. If Tcp is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If Http is specified, a 200 OK response from the specified URI is required for the probe to be successful.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) Port on which the Probe queries the backend endpoint. Possible values range from 1 to 65535, inclusive.

properties.name: request_path
properties.description: (Optional) The URI used for requesting health status from the backend endpoint. Required if protocol is set to Http. Otherwise, it is not allowed.

properties.name: interval_in_seconds
properties.description: (Optional) The interval, in seconds between probes to the backend endpoint for health status. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.

properties.name: number_of_probes
properties.description: (Optional) The number of failed probe attempts after which the backend endpoint is removed from rotation. The default value is 2. NumberOfProbes multiplied by intervalInSeconds value must be greater or equal to 10.Endpoints are returned to rotation when at least one probe is successful.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the NAT pool.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the NAT pool.

properties.name: frontend_ip_configuration_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration exposing this rule.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are Udp or Tcp.

properties.name: frontend_port_start
properties.description: (Required) The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

properties.name: frontend_port_end
properties.description: (Required) The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

properties.name: backend_port
properties.description: (Required) The port used for the internal endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the template deployment. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the template deployment.

properties.name: deployment_mode
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the mode that is used to deploy resources. This value could be either Incremental or Complete. Note that you will almost always want this to be set to Incremental otherwise the deployment will destroy all infrastructure not specified within the template, and Terraform will not be aware of this.

properties.name: template_body
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the JSON definition for the template.
Note: There's a file function available which allows you to read this from an external file, which helps makes this more resource more readable.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: • parameters - (Optional) Specifies the name and value pairs that define the deployment parameters for the template.

properties.name: parameters_body
properties.description: • parameters_body - (Optional) Specifies a valid Azure JSON parameters file that define the deployment parameters. It can contain KeyVault references
Note: There's an file interpolation function available which allows you to read this from an external file, which helps makes this more resource more readable.
